seniors.name: Sourabh Kumawat
seniors.poem:
In the quiet lab, where dreams would weave,
Two hearts met, on a golden eve.
Through pages turned and data traced,
Love found light in that sacred space.
Her head would rest upon my chest,
A fleeting touch, a moment blessed.
Fingers brushed, a whispered sigh,
Time stood still as love passed by.
Yet when the echoes of footsteps came,
She’d pull away, her cheeks aflame.
A stolen glance, a secret smile,
Love unspoken, yet known all the while.
Though fate may drift like waves to shore,
Some memories last forevermore.
In that last semester’s fleeting hue,
She was my love—soft, yet true.

seniors.name: Suthar shravankumar tejaram
seniors.poem:
The screen once held me, night and day,
In pixel worlds, I'd lose my way.
Quests and battles filled my mind,
Yet real-life joys were left behind.

The ticking clock, I paid no heed,
Chasing scores with endless need.
Friends grew distant, dreams stood still,
Trapped within the gaming thrill.

Then one day, I broke the chain,
Stepped outside in sun and rain.
The world was vast, so much to see,
A life beyond the games—just me.

No longer lost in endless play,
I found my path, a brighter day.
Now I live where moments last,
Not in a screen, but in my past.

seniors.name: Sk Arif
seniors.poem:
Felt a little weak, just a slight unease,
Brushed it off like a passing breeze.
But yellow eyes stared back at me,
A warning sign I failed to see.

Fatigue took over, meals felt bland,
Every sip of water tasted like sand.
Doctor’s words hit like a heavy blow,
Jaundice—nowhere else to go.

Days in bed, light too bright,
Nausea creeping in every night.
No more junk, no more fun,
Just rest and meds till the battle’s won.

Lesson learned, health comes first,
Ignoring signs makes things worse.
Slowly healed, but I now feel,
Jaundice hit hard—shit got real.

seniors.name: Aarti Nagpal
seniors.poem:
Beats of the dhol, the rhythm so tight,
Foundation Day coming, hearts feel light.
Steps in sync, the practice goes on,
Dancing till dusk, from early dawn.

Himachali Naati, a tale so grand,
Echoes of hills in every hand.
Spins so graceful, voices high,
Colors of Himachal touch the sky.

Laughter spills as mistakes we make,
Fixing the steps, no time for a break.
Energy high, the spirits soar,
Dancing like never before.

The day arrives, the crowd in cheer,
All our efforts shine so clear.
A final bow, the applause so bright,
Naati’s soul, pure delight.

seniors.name: Yadhu krishnan
seniors.poem:
Golden hues melt into the sky,
Sunsets paint the clouds so high.
Footsteps echo on quiet lanes,
Soft breeze whispers, easing pains.

Shadows stretch as twilight calls,
Campus glows in amber halls.
Silent laughter, stories untold,
Memories carved in dusk’s soft gold.

Streetlights flicker, paths unwind,
Moonlight dances, hearts aligned.
Late-night talks, the world feels light,
Dreams take flight in silver night.

Moments linger, time stands still,
Every step a gentle thrill.
Sunsets fade, but feelings stay,
Campus nights won’t drift away.

seniors.name: Anil Kumar Sharma
seniors.poem:
Every corner holds a tale,
Laughter echoes, never pale.
Two whole years of joy and strife,
Moments shining, full of life.

Classroom whispers, sleepless nights,
Endless talks under dim streetlights.
Library silence, coffee sips,
Midnight walks and friendship trips.

Festival lights, dance so free,
Smiles that turn to memories.
Dreams were shaped, bonds grew strong,
Every day a cherished song.

Which to choose? I cannot say,
Each one brightens up my way.
Two whole years, a golden hue,
Every moment feels so true.

seniors.name: Sreeram H R
seniors.poem:
Days began with lectures bright,
Coding, research, and sleepless nights.
Genome maps and protein chains,
Data crunching filled our brains.

Library corners, endless reads,
Chasing knowledge, planting seeds.
Projects, papers, deadlines tight,
Yet every struggle felt so right.

Hostel talks and chai so strong,
Late-night walks felt like a song.
Workshops, labs, and conference days,
Learning in a hundred ways.

Two years passed like fleeting streams,
Built with passion, filled with dreams.
MSc life, a journey grand,
Memories etched like lines in sand.

seniors.name: Yash Pandit
seniors.poem:
First day stepped with dreams so high,
Nervous smiles, yet hopes touched sky.
New faces, unknown ways,
A fresh start in bioinformatics maze.

Labs so bright with screens aglow,
Sequences, codes began to flow.
Professors spoke of genes untold,
Fascination took a deeper hold.

Icebreakers, laughs, friendships new,
Hostel chats and midnight brew.
Campus walks, exploring space,
Feeling home in a brand-new place.

From that day, the journey spun,
Challenges faced, yet growth begun.
First steps led to paths so wide,
In CUP, with pride inside.

seniors.name: Manulal
seniors.poem:
Freshers' Day, the lights shone bright,
Excitement filled the air that night.
New beginnings, laughter, cheer,
A welcome hug to ease the fear.

Seniors smiled, the stage was set,
Games and fun, no time to fret.
Dances, songs, a grand delight,
Memories made in golden light.

Cheering loud, the hall alive,
A night where all our hopes would thrive.
From strangers turned to friends so fast,
A bond was built to always last.

Photos clicked, the joy so true,
A perfect start, a vibrant view.
Freshers' night, a tale so fine,
A moment cherished, forever mine.

seniors.name: Vivek Brahma
seniors.poem:
Binary Beginning, a brand-new phase,
Stepping in with hopeful gaze.
Zeros and ones, a coded start,
Bioinformatics etched in heart.

Algorithms weave through fate,
Genes and data correlate.
Pipelines run, the queries flow,
Knowledge builds as concepts grow.

From sequence chains to ML's might,
Decoding life, a thrilling sight.
Clusters form, like friendships true,
In silico dreams start to brew.

A journey vast, yet paths align,
Binary dawn, a spark divine.
In CUP, the code unfurls,
A world unlocked, a maze of pearls.

seniors.name: Ashutosh Jha
seniors.poem:
Fresher's party, lights so bright,
Music echoed, pure delight.
Then I saw her, standing there,
Graceful steps, a gaze so rare.

Eyes that shimmered, deep and wide,
Like the moon that kissed the tide.
Every move, a melody sweet,
A moment my heart won't repeat.

Lost in time, the world stood still,
A memory carved with sheer thrill.
Beauty wrapped in charm divine,
A fleeting glance, yet so sublime.

That night remains, a golden trace,
A special glow I can't replace.
A junior’s charm, a spell so true,
In college life, a dream that grew.

seniors.name: Ashish Kumar
seniors.poem:
First day of college, nervous and new,
Looking around, unsure what to do.
Then walked in Preeti Sir so tall,
A mystery that puzzled us all.

Whispers floated, doubts took flight,
Is it sir or madam?—pure delight!
Confusion danced in every stare,
Yet no one dared to really declare.

Roll call echoed, the moment near,
Heartbeats raced, filled with cheer.
Preeti Sir, the truth was told,
Laughter burst, uncontrolled.

That first-day mix-up, a tale so bright,
Still makes us laugh, pure delight.
A memory sealed in fun so grand,
College life began, unplanned!

seniors.name: Singu Bhavya sri
seniors.poem:
Friends in CuPb, a bond so true,
Through every storm, we push right through.
Late-night talks and chai so strong,
In every moment, we belong.

Library whispers, endless debates,
Laughs in labs, forgetting the weights.
Deadlines chase, but we stand tall,
Together we rise, never to fall.

Hostel nights and mess food woes,
Yet with them, the happiness flows.
Exams, fests, and memories bright,
Side by side, we win the fight.

Two years here, yet bonds won’t fade,
Friends for life, the best we've made.
From CuPb, we’ll soon depart,
But forever, you'll stay in my heart.

seniors.name: Mansi Shamrao Sukhadeve
seniors.poem:
End sem stress in the freezing cold,
Three degrees, yet we stayed bold.
Wrapped in blankets, books in hand,
Fighting sleep, we took our stand.

Two workshops, we gave our best,
Volunteering hard, no time to rest.
Running around, making it right,
Still found joy in the sleepless nights.

Rishikesh roads, Mussoorie mist,
Memories carved that still persist.
Laughter echoed, rivers wide,
Mountains stood by our side.

Delhi chaos, Amritsar’s grace,
Exams took us place to place.
Tiring days, but hearts so free,
Every moment, a memory to be.

seniors.name: Fasil Rahman
seniors.poem:
Every day at CUPB felt so bright,
Greenery wrapped in golden light.
Lush trees swayed in morning breeze,
Whispering tales with rustling leaves.

Friendship blossomed, strong and true,
Laughter echoed, skies so blue.
Midnight talks and chai so warm,
Hearts found comfort in every storm.

Love sparked softly, eyes would meet,
Campus paths felt bittersweet.
Silent walks, hands so near,
Moments held forever dear.

Books and notes, the study grind,
Yet joy and wisdom intertwined.
Every page, a story new,
CUPB days, a dream come true.

seniors.name: Parul Soni
seniors.poem:
The hall was bright, the lights were dim,
A night of laughter, hearts brimmed to the rim.
Our seniors stood, smiles so wide,
Yet in their eyes, a farewell tide.

Words of wisdom, tales retold,
Memories cherished, pure and gold.
From classes tough to moments light,
They shaped our days, our guiding light.

Clicks and hugs, the music played,
Dances wild, yet hearts dismayed.
One last toast, a promise made,
Friendships strong will never fade.

Though they leave, their mark remains,
In every hall, in every lane.
Seniors dear, though paths may bend,
You'll stay with us, till the very end.

seniors.name: Risal Abdulsathar
seniors.poem:
Aroma swirling, spices blend,
Food Fest calls, a taste to lend.
Stalls lined up, colors bright,
Dishes gleam in golden light.

Sizzling pans and laughter loud,
Flavors dancing in the crowd.
Bites of sweet, a sip of spice,
Every plate—a sheer delight.

Friends explore with hungry eyes,
One more dish? Oh, let's not lie!
From momos soft to chaats so grand,
Every taste, a journey planned.

Memories made with every bite,
Savoring joy from noon to night.
Food Fest fades, but hearts still crave,
For flavors shared and fun we saved.

seniors.name: Shristy Rathore
seniors.poem:
Crashing in, the beats were loud,
Lights were flashing, wild the crowd.
Laughter high, we danced so free,
'Till they said, Out! You don’t belong, you see!

Shocked and grinning, no place to stay,
Wandered off, made our own way.
Hunger struck, but spirits tall,
A feast to cook—we had it all!

Santoshi stirred, the flames danced bright,
Chopping, frying, pure delight.
Stories spun as flavors blend,
A party lost, but gained a friend.

Banned from one, yet found our own,
Laughter, warmth—our joy had grown.
Thrown away, yet here we stand,
The best of times are never planned.

seniors.name: Bhagath Raj
seniors.poem:
Laughter echoes, steps align,
Through the streets, the stars still shine.
Jokes and stories, endless spree,
Time dissolves so effortlessly.

Tea stall talks and midnight strolls,
Carefree hearts and unchained souls.
Sunset views, the world so wide,
Side by side, with joy as guide.

Random plans and songs we scream,
Moments turning into dreams.
Bonds so pure, no need to try,
With friends like these, we touch the sky.

Days may change, but ties stay tight,
Golden memories, shining bright.
Through every turn, through thick and thin,
With friends, each day’s a win!

seniors.name: Rosaria Emmanuel
seniors.poem:
Class was silent, minds were keen,
Then came a clash, a sudden scene.
Saraboji Sir, so firm, so wise,
Yet in debate, we’d lock our eyes.

That's incorrect! he'd sternly claim,
We'd counter back, fueling the flame.
Facts and logic, tossed and spun,
A battle fought, yet all in fun.

Arguments sharp, but laughter near,
No grudges held, just knowledge clear.
Respect intact, yet words would fly,
Neither would bend, no need to try.

Lessons learned in every fight,
Bickering turned the dull to bright.
Years may pass, but one thing’s sure,
Those fiery talks—we still adore!

seniors.name: Devika k
seniors.poem:
Nothing to lose, nothing to gain,
Nothing but echoes calling my name.
Nothing to chase, nothing to find,
Nothing but silence filling my mind.
Nothing to laugh, nothing to cry,
Nothing but time just passing by.
Nothing to hold, nothing to break,
Nothing but memories left in its wake.
Nothing to run, nothing to stay,
Nothing but footsteps fading away.
Nothing to love, nothing to hate,
Nothing but fate deciding my state.
Nothing to start, nothing to end,
Nothing but nothing, my only friend.

seniors.name: Santoshi Upadhyay
seniors.poem:
Dancing at every damn event, wild and free,
Spinning in rhythm, just you and me.
Laughter erupts as the beats grow strong,
Feet never resting, the nights feel long.
From freshers to farewells, stage our own,
Every move, every step, perfectly known.
Crowds may change, but we remain,
Drenched in joy, forgetting the pain.
Evening tea, our sacred space,
Sipping warmth at a slow, calm pace.
Stories unfold with every sip,
Life’s little moments, we tightly grip.
From music to chai, from cheers to rest,
These fleeting times, they feel the best.

seniors.name: Dheeraj krishna
seniors.poem:
All the moments with friends, engraved so deep,
Late-night talks when none could sleep.
Laughter echoing through hostel walls,
Random plans and unplanned calls.
Mess food rants and chai so strong,
Singing together, every song.
Library whispers, last-minute race,
Assignments done at a reckless pace.
Trips we took, the memories made,
Standing by each other, never afraid.
Endless jokes, the pranks we played,
In every chaos, love never swayed.
Through highs and lows, near or far,
Friends like family, our brightest star.

seniors.name: Kriti Sharma
seniors.poem:
Every day was special, every laugh so bright,
Dancing Naati with my team felt just right.
Freely we moved, lost in the beat,
With friends and hostel mates, moments so sweet.
No stress of exams could pull us down,
Together we shone, never a frown.
That unity, that unbreakable bond,
Through every struggle, we carried on.
Convocation day, seniors came back,
Same old energy, nothing they lacked.
A year had passed, yet it felt the same,
Their return ignited an endless flame.
Every moment with friends, a story untold,
Memories so precious, more than gold.
These 1.5 years, words fall short,
A chapter of life, a beautiful thought.

seniors.name: Parvathi
seniors.poem:
Packing my bags, the journey is near,
Going home, the feeling so clear.
The train hums, the road unwinds,
Leaving the campus, memories in mind.
Hostel laughter, midnight talks,
Echo in footsteps as I walk.
The gate ahead, a final glance,
A heart divided in a silent dance.
Home awaits with warmth so deep,
Yet college days I'll always keep.
Mom’s embrace, the sweetest part,
Filling the void left in my heart.
New stories to tell, old ones to miss,
A cycle of joy, a moment of bliss.
Leaving, returning, again and again,
Home and college, both remain.

seniors.name: Nandana C Shekhar
seniors.poem:
Every day was memorable in a way or another,
Some with laughter, some with wonder.
Morning sun on the campus ground,
Evening tea where stories were found.
Late-night walks, endless talks,
Exam stress and midnight mocks.
Festivals danced in colors so bright,
Random plans turned into delight.
Library hours and canteen cheer,
Each moment etched, forever near.
Friendships growing, lessons learned,
Hearts full, with memories earned.
Days may fade, but moments stay,
In every little, beautiful way.
